__comments.Note to reader:
The datastructures below are a direct translation of the pdf's included in this repository,
which are assumed to be taken from official Siemens documentation at the time of this writing.
For that reason the values associated with byte, variable_name, type, and comment should be viewed as partly historical as they have been directly transposed from that official documentation.
Additional fields are all added for additional convenience to the user/author/developer and should be viewed from that lense
__comments.ecat_headers:
Entries in this dictionary are labeled <ecat version number ><mainheader or integer code type for subheader>
 the integer code types for each subheader correspond to FILE_TYPE field in the main header
    ECAT 7.2 Only
    Subheader types correspond to these enumerated types as defined below:
    00 = unknown, 
    01 = Sinogram, 
    02 = Image - 16, 
    03 = Attenuation Correction, 
    04 = Normalization, 
    05 = PolarMap, 
    06 = Volume 8, 
    07 = Volume 16, 
    08 = Projection 8, 
    09 = Projection 16, 
    10 = Image 8, 
    11 = 3D Sinogram 16, 
    12 = 3D Sinogram 8, 
    13 = 3D Normalization, 
    14 = 3D Sinogram Fit)

    Presently, only types 03, 05, 07, 11, and 13 correspond to known subheader types for 72. If the
    value in FILE_TYPE is outside of this range the subheaders will not be read and this will
    raise an exception.
    
    ECAT 7.3 Only
    00 = unknown
    01 = unknown
    02 = unknown
    03 = Attenuation Correction
    04 = unknown
    05 = unknown
    06 = unknown
    07 = Volume 16
    08 = unknown
    09 = unknown
    10 = unknown
    11 = 3D Sinogram 16
__comments.type: refers to the type of data defined in the ECAT documentation; includes: Integer*2, Integer*4, Real*4, and Character*N
__comments.variable_name: refers to the name of the variable as defined in the ECAT documentation, case sensitive
__comments.byte: refers to the absolute byte position, data is organized in the same order as byte position such that list[0] -> the 0th byte
__comments.struct: the c struct data type format of the variable,
__comments.comment: refers to the comment field from the ECAT documentation, some comments list enumerated types as type1, type2, etc., etc. at the time of this writing those et cetera are unknown, good luck.
__comments.enumerated_values: Best guesses and translations of the possible enumerated types in the comments
__comments.units: when possible the units corresponding to each byte/variable name are defined here

mainheader.comment: Unique ID of the ECAT system used
Bed height (in cm.) from lowest point
Distance (in cm.) from first to last plane
Number of planes of data collected
Number of frames of data collected
Number of gates of data collected
Number of bed positions of data collected
Absolute bed location of bed position 0 (cm.)
Lowest threshold setting for scatter (in KeV)
Lower threshold setting for trues (in KeV)
Upper threshold setting for trues (in KeV)

subheader_matrix_scan_files.comment: Designates processing applied to scan data
Actual Distance of view sample (in cm.)
Time from start of first gate (in msec.)
Total prompts collected in this frame/gate
Total delays collected in this frame/gate
Total multiples collected in the frame/gate
Total singles with loss correction factoring
Total singles without loss correction factoring
Mean value of singles (not loss corrected)
Time offset from first frame time (in msec.)
Total duration of current frame (in msec.)
Loss correction factor applied to the sinogram

subheader_matrix_image_files.comment: Offset in x axis for recon target (in cm.)
Offset in y axis for recon target (in cm.)
Total duration of current frame (in msec.)
Frame start time (offset from first frame)
Location offset from initial bed position (cm.)
File index to corresponding scan data
File index to corresponding normal data
File index to attenuation correction data
Isotope deca compensation applied to data
Cutoff frequency, DC component, ramp slope

mainheader.comment: UNIX file type identification number (NOT PART OF THE MATRIX HEADER DATA)

Enumerated type (00=unknown, 01=Sinogram, 02=Image-16, 03=Attenuation Correction, 04=Normalization, 05=Polar Map, 06=Volume 8, 07=Volume 16, 08=Projection 8, 09=Projection 16, 10=Image 8, 11=3D Sinogram 16, 12=3D Sinogram 8, 13=3D Normalization, 14=3D Sinogram Fit)
The serial number of the gantry
Date and time that acquisition was started (in secs from base time)
Bed height (in cm.) from lowest point
Angle (in degrees),Angle that the first detector of Bucket 0 is offset from top center (in degrees)
Enumerated type (0=Net Trues, 1=Prompts and Delayed, 3= Prompts, Delayed, and Multiples)
Quantification scale factor (to convert from ECAT counts to activity counts)
Enumerated type (COMP_NONE, (This is the only value))
Enumerated type (0=Undefined, 1=Blank, 2=Transmission, 3=Static emission, 4=Dynamic emission, 5=Gated emission, 6=Transmission rectilinear, 7=Emission rectilinear)
Enumerated Type (Bit 0 clear - Feet first, Bit 0 set - Head first, Bit 1-2 00 - Prone, Bit 1-2 01 - Supine, Bit 1-2 10 - Decubitus Right, Bit 1-2 11 - Decubitus Left)
Number of planes of data collected
Number of frames of data collected OR Highest frame number (in partially reconstructed files)
Number of gates of data collected
Number of bed positions of data collected
Absolute location of initial bed position (in cm.)
Physical distance between adjacent planes (in cm.)
Lowest threshold setting for scatter (in KeV)
Lower threshold setting for trues in (in KeV)
Upper threshold setting for trues (in KeV)
Enumerated Type (0=Normal, 1=Windowed, 2=Windowed & Nonwindowed, 3=Dual energy, 4=Upper energy, 5=Emission and Transmission)
Fraction of decay by positron emission
Actual time radiopharmaceutical was injected or flow was started (in sec since base time)
Radiopharmaceutical dosage (in bequerels/cc) at time of injection
Septa position during scan (0=septa extended, 1=septa retracted)

3.comment: Enumerated type (DTYPE_BYTES, _I2, _I4, _VAXR4, _SUNFL, _SUNIN)
Number of dimensions
E. type (ATTEN_NONE, _MEAS, _CALC)
Total elements collected (x dimension)
Total views collected (y dimensions)
Total elements collected (z dimension)
Maximum acceptance angle.
Resolution in the x dimension (in cm)
Resolution in the y dimension (in cm)
Resolution in the z dimension (in cm)
TBD
Attenuation Scale Factor
Ellipse offset in x axis from center (in cm.)
Ellipse offset in y axis from center (in cm.)
Ellipse radius in x axis (in cm.)
Ellipse radius in y axis (in cm.)
Tilt angel of the ellipse (in degrees)
M u-absorption coefficient (in cm^-1)
Minimum value in the attenuation data
Maximum value in the attenuation data
Skull thickness in cm
Number of attenuation coefficients other than the Mu absorption coefficient above (max 8)
The additional attention coefficient values
The threshold value used by automatic edge-detection routine (fraction of maximum)
Data storage order (RThetaZD, RZThetaD)
Axial compression specifier (number of ring differences spanned by a segment)
Number of 'planes' in z direction for each ring difference segment
Unused (172 bytes)
User Reserved space (100 bytes) Note: use highest bytes first

7.comment: Enumerated type (0=Unknown Matrix Data Type, 1=Byte Data, 2=VAX_Ix2, 3=VAX_Ix4, 4=VAX_Rx4, 5=IEEE Float, 6=Sun short, 7=Sun long)
Offset in x axis for recon target (in cm)
Offset in y axis for recon target (in cm)
Offset in z axis for recon target (in cm)
Total duration of current frame (in msec.)
frame start time (offset from first frame, in msec)
resolution in the x dimension (in cm)
resolution in the y dimension (in cm)
resolution in the z dimension (in cm)
rotation in the xy plane (in degrees). Use right-hand coordinate system for rotation angle sign.
isotope decay compensation applied to data

bit mask (0=not processed, 1=normalized, 2=Measured Attenuation Correction, 4=Calculated attenuation correction, 8=x smoothing, 16=Y smoothing, 32=Z smoothing, 64=2d scatter correction, 128=3D scatter correction, 256=arc correction, 512=decay correction, 1024=Online compression)
r wave offset (for phase sliced studies, average, in msec)
number of accepted beats for this gate
Number of views used to reconstruct the data
User Reserved space (100 bytes) Note: Use highest bytes first

5.comment: Enumerated type (DTYPE_BYTES, _I2,_I4)
Enumerated Type (Always 0 for now; denotes the version of the PM structure)
Number of rings in this polar map
Number of sectors in each ring for up to 32 rings (1, 9, 18, or 32 sectors normally)
Fractional distance along the long axis from base to apex
Ring angle relative to long axis(90 degrees along cylinder, decreasing to 0 at the apex)
Start angle for rings (Always 258 degrees, defines Polar Map’s 0)
x, y, z location of long axis base end (in pixels)
x, y, z location of long axis apex end (in pixels)
Enumerated type (0 - Not available, 1 - Present)
Minimum pixel value in this polar map
Maximum pixel value in this polar map
Scale factor to restore integer values to float values
Pixel size (in cubic cm, represents voxels)
Total duration of current frame (in msec)
Frame start time (offset from first frame, in msec)

Bit Encoded (1- Map type (0 = Sector Analysis, 1 = Volumetric), 2 - Threshold Applied, 3 - Summed Map, 4 - Subtracted Map, 5 - Product of two maps, 6 - Ratio of two maps, 7 - Bias, 8 - Multiplier, 9 - Transform, 10 - Polar Map calculational protocol used)
Enumerated Type (0 - Default (see main header), 1 - Normalized, 2 - Mean, 3 - Std. Deviation from Mean)
label for polar map display
Gate duration (in msec)
R wave offset (Average, in msec)
Number of accepted beats for this gate
Polar Map protocol used to generate this polar map
Database name used for polar map comparison
Reserved for future CTI use (54 bytes)
User reserved space (54 bytes) Note: Use highest bytes first

Number of Dimensions
Total views collected (θ dimension)
Total views collected (θ dimension)
Designates processing applied to scan data (Bit encoded, Bit 0 - Norm, Bit 1 - Atten, Bit 2 - Smooth)
Number of elements in z dimension for each ring difference segment in 3D scans
Max ring difference (d dimension) in this frame
Data storage order (rθzd or rzθd)
Axial compression code or factor, generally referred to as SPAN
Resolution in the r dimension (in cm)
Resolution in the θ dimension (in radians)
Resolution in the z dimension (in cm)
Not Used
RESERVED for gating
Gating segment length (msec, Average time if phased gates are used)
Time from start of first gate (Average, in msec.)
Number of accepted beats for this gate
If data type is integer, this factor is used to convert to float values
Minimum value in sinogram if data is in integer form  (not currently filled in)
Maximum value in sinogram if data is in integer form  (not currently filled in)
Total prompts collected in this frame/gate
Total delays collected in this frame/gate
Total multiples collected in this frame/gate (notused)
Total net trues (prompts–-randoms)
Mean value of loss-corrected singles
Mean value of singles (not loss corrected)
Measured coincidence rate (from IPCP)
Time offset from first frame time (in msec.)
Total duration of current frame (in msec.)
Dead-time correction factor applied to the sinogram
CTI Reserved space (180 bytes)
User Reserved space (100 bytes) Note: Use highest bytes first
Total uncorrected singles from each bucket

13.comment: Number of transaxial crystals per block
Number of rows in the Plane Geometric Correction array
Used by Daily Check to determine the quality of the scanner
First “per ring” dead time correction coefficient
Second “per ring” dead time correction coefficient
Dead time correction factors for transaxial crystals
Axial compression specifier (number of ring differences included in each segment)
User Reserved space (100 bytes) Note: Use highest bytes first
